title: Go Language For Network Administration

It was created as a response to the growing complexity of these languages and the difficulty of finding developers who could work in them.
The design of Go was inspired by previous languages, such as C and Pascal. It was intended to be easy to read and understand, even for developers who were not experienced with programming. The designers of Go also wanted the language to be able to handle the huge scale of Google\u2019s infrastructure. The main advantage that network administrators get from using Go is that it is easy to write reliable code.
